#### "Ethics is important. Ethics processes are insane." (comment on our petition)

--

#### [A national study of 50 hospitals examining hand hygiene practices](https://researchintegrityjournal.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s41073-016-0023-6)

* Spent $348,000 in staff time on approvals
* Almost all duplicated our original approval
* Delayed study by 17 months

--

#### [Data linkage project examining national vaccine surveillance](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/1753-6405.12929)

* Took 6 years to get the data
* No access in Western Australia
* Huge variation in requests
* "process trumps potential public good"

--

#### Inquiry seems justified given the size and complexity of the issues

## Estimated economic cost

#### Costs based on:

* 14,200 low-risk applications nationally per year
* 65 days needed per application
* Salary research assistant ~$66K; cost per application = $12K
* National cost $168 million
--

* Savings for a self-certification = $163 million per year
